thread.title: Middletown, Chicago Cubs Schwarber HR ball remains on display
thread.title_full: Middletown, Chicago Cubs Schwarber HR ball remains on display

title: Middletown, Chicago Cubs Schwarber HR ball remains on display
text:
Posted: 9:04 p.m. Wednesday, Oct. 14, 2015 Middletown, Chicago Cubs Schwarber HR ball remains on display Chicago Cubs left fielder Kyle Schwarber gives high-fives to fans after the Cubs won 6-4 in Game 4 in baseball's National League Division Series against the St. Louis Cardinals, Tuesday, Oct. 13, 2015, in Chicago. (AP Photo/Nam Y. Huh) By Staff 
The ball hit by Middletown High School graduate Kyle Schwarber for a monstrous home run in the Cubs’ series-clinching win over the Cardinals on Tuesday landed on top of the right field video board at Wrigley Field and won’t be going anywhere soon. After retrieving and authenticating it, the Cubs returned the ball and said they will leave it there until their postseason run has concluded. The Cubs said a plexiglass case has been built to preserve the ball from the elements and that security will escort anyone going up to the top of the video board to service it so it won’t be stolen. More News
